xxl.core.relational.cursors
Class SortBasedDifference

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.cursors.AbstractCursor<E>
      xxl.core.cursors.differences.SortBasedDifference<Tuple>
          xxl.core.relational.cursors.SortBasedDifference
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.Iterator<Tuple>, Cursor<Tuple>, MetaDataCursor<Tuple,CompositeMetaData<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>>, MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>>
public class SortBasedDifference
extends SortBasedDifference<Tuple>
implements MetaDataCursor<Tuple,CompositeMetaData<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>>

Operator computing the difference of two sorted metadata cursors. This class uses the algorithm of SortBasedDifference and additionally computes the metadata. Relational metadata is checked whether it fits.

Caution: the input iterations have to be sorted! To sort a metadata cursor use a merge-sorter.

Constructor Detail

SortBasedDifference

public SortBasedDifference(MetaDataCursor<Tuple,CompositeMetaData<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>> sortedInput1,
                           MetaDataCursor<? extends Tuple,CompositeMetaData<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>> sortedInput2,
                           java.util.Comparator<? super Tuple> comparator,
                           boolean all,
                           boolean asc)
Constructs a sort-based difference operator (metadata cursor) that computes the difference between two sorted input metadata cursors. The parameters are the same compared to SortBasedDifference.

To get a correct result, the input relations have to be sorted. To sort a metadata cursor use a merge-sorter.

See also Tuples for static methods delivering ready to use tuple comparators.

Parameters:
sortedInput1 - the first input metadata cursor.
sortedInput2 - the second input metadata cursor.
comparator - a comparator used to compare two tuples. To get a comparator that compares tuples after some specified columns use one of the getTupleComparator in Tuples.
all - mode of the difference operation. If the mode is true, all tuples of the first relation, which have a counterpart in the second relation, are removed. If the mode is false, for each tuple of the second relation, only one tuple of the first relation is removed at most.
asc - a flag showing if the input cursors have been sorted ascending or not.

SortBasedDifference

public SortBasedDifference(java.sql.ResultSet sortedResultSet1,
                           java.sql.ResultSet sortedResultSet2,
                           java.util.Comparator<? super Tuple> comparator,
                           boolean all,
                           boolean asc)
Constructs a sort-based difference operator (metadata cursor) that computes the difference between two sorted input result sets. The result sets are wrapped to metadata cursors using ResultSetMetaDataCursor.

To get a correct result, the input relations have to be sorted.

See also Tuples for static methods delivering ready to use tuple comparators.

Parameters:
sortedResultSet1 - the first input result set.
sortedResultSet2 - the second input result set.
comparator - a comparator used to compare two tuples. To get a comparator that compares tuples after some specified columns use one of the getTupleComparator in Tuples.
all - mode of the difference operation. If the mode is true, all tuples of the first relation, which have a counterpart in the second relation, are removed. If the mode is false, for each tuple of the second relation, only one tuple of the first relation is removed at most.
asc - a flag showing if the input cursors have been sorted ascending or not.
